content: pedestrian a basic sock pattern by veronica parsons there are a lot of basic sock patterns out there this is the one i use for myself this pattern makes a top-down sock with a slipped stitch heel flap and a flat toe you can knit the leg and top of the foot either in stockinette stitch or ribbing © veronica parsons 2018 page 1 of 4 pedestrian notes i recommend the following combinations of stitch this pattern is given in several stitch counts patterns choose one socks are pretty personal so you ll need to find the happy medium between your yarn needles k1 p1 ribbing on the cuff with a k3 p1 rib for gauge and leg/foot size for the best fitting socks the leg and instep of the sock k2 p2 ribbing on the cuff with stockinette socks should be made with no ease or a tiny bit of stitch for the remainder of the sock negative ease 56 stitches is a good starting point for sport weight yarn or if you have small feet 72 cuff stitches works well for skinny sock yarns and/or cast on 56 60 64 68 72 stitches and join to work medium-large feet socks should also be knit at a in the round being careful not to twist distribute relatively dense gauge to ensure their longevity the stitches however you want but i usually work in a square 14 15 16 17 18 stitches per needle this pattern is given with the smallest stitch count first with other stitch counts in parentheses when work the cuff in your choice of ribbing k1 p1 there is only one number it refers to all sizes or k2 p2 my rule of thumb is to work as many rounds of ribbing as there are stitches on one slip all stitches as if to purl unless working ssk needle i e 14 15 16 17 18 rounds but that s up to you a tutorial for grafting kitchener stitch can be found here https //www purlsoho com/create/ leg kitchener-stitch-video/ switch to either k3 p1 ribbing or stockinette stitch and continue until the leg is as long as you want it or the length of your hand from the cast-on edge usually this is about 6-7 for mid-calf length socks heel flap the heel flap is worked flat over half of your stitches leave the remaining 28 30 32 34 36 stitches on hold for the top of the foot row 1 right side slip 1 k27 29 31 33 35 turn row 2 wrong side slip 1 p1 across turn repeat these 2 row until heel flap measures approximately 2 25 or you have 16 17 18 19 20 for many people the length of your hand from pairs of row ending with a wrong side row you the heel of your palm to the tip of your middle can work more or fewer row to best fit your foot finger is a good rough measuring
